title: Newtons second law - block between two objects

content.question: A block is held in place on a rough ramp. A box, which is larger in size than the block, is attached by a string to a wall at the top of the ramp. The box is at rest on top of the block, and there is negligible friction between them. When the block is released, it begins to slide down the ramp with initial acceleration <math alttext="a sub 1" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>a</mi><mn>1</mn></msub></math>. Then, additional mass is added to the box, the procedure is repeated, and the block begins sliding with initial acceleration <math alttext="a sub 2" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>a</mi><mn>2</mn></msub></math>. Which of the following correctly compares <math alttext="a sub 1" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>a</mi><mn>1</mn></msub></math> to <math alttext="a sub 2" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>a</mi><mn>2</mn></msub></math> and provides a valid justification?

choices.label: <math alttext="a sub 2 is less than a sub 1" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>a</mi><mn>2</mn></msub><mo><</mo><msub><mi>a</mi><mn>1</mn></msub></math> because the additional mass of the block-box system increases the force of friction exerted on the block by the ramp.

<math alttext="a sub 2 is less than a sub 1" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>a</mi><mn>2</mn></msub><mo><</mo><msub><mi>a</mi><mn>1</mn></msub></math> because the tension in the string becomes larger to support the additional weight in the box.

<math alttext="a sub 2 equals a sub 1" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>a</mi><mn>2</mn></msub><mo>=</mo><msub><mi>a</mi><mn>1</mn></msub></math> because the force of friction between the block and the box is negligible.

<math alttext="a sub 2 equals a sub 1" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>a</mi><mn>2</mn></msub><mo>=</mo><msub><mi>a</mi><mn>1</mn></msub></math> because the component of the weight force parallel to the ramp increases in proportion to the mass of the box-block system.

content.answer: <math alttext="a sub 2 is less than a sub 1" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>a</mi><mn>2</mn></msub><mo><</mo><msub><mi>a</mi><mn>1</mn></msub></math> because the additional mass of the block-box system increases the force of friction exerted on the block by the ramp.
